channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-9539] Wrong check of version format in TestWebHCatE2e.getHiveVersion()
item.description:
Bug caused by HIVE-9485.

Test of org.apache.hive.hcatalog.templeton.TestWebHCatE2e.getHiveVersion() check that version in that format : 0.[0-9].[0-9].*
This doesn't works since HIVE version is like 1.2.0-SNAPHSOT
item.summary: Wrong check of version format in TestWebHCatE2e.getHiveVersion()

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
It's a one line patch in this method :

@Test
public void getHiveVersion() throws Exception {
MethodCallRetVal p = doHttpCall(templetonBaseUrl + "/version/hive",
HTTP_METHOD_TYPE.GET);
Assert.assertEquals(HttpStatus.OK_200, p.httpStatusCode);
Map<String, Object> props = JsonBuilder.jsonToMap(p.responseBody);
Assert.assertEquals("hive", props.get("module"));
Assert.assertTrue(p.getAssertMsg(),
((String) props.get("version")).matches("0.[0-9]+.[0-9]+.*"));
}

Line 244 should be : 

((String) props.get("version")).matches("[0-9]+.[0-9]+.[0-9]+.*"));

Instead of 

((String) props.get("version")).matches("0.[0-9]+.[0-9]+.*"));

For record :

GET http://localhost:52505/templeton/v1/version/hive?user.name=johndoe

Returns :

 {"module":"hive","version":"1.2.0-SNAPSHOT"}

Overall: -1 no tests executed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12695813/HIVE-9539.patch

Test results: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/2608/testReport
Console output: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/2608/console
Test logs: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/logs/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build-2608/

thejas this bug affect also branch-1.0 and branch-1.1 as reported in HIVE-9853.
Could we apply this path to those branches? Should I create two more patchs, one for each branch?

damien.carol Does the patch apply as-is to those branches ? If yes, two new patches aren't needed. We can apply the same one to 1.0 and 1.1 branches. We just need to check with release managers for those releases (vikram.dixit and brocknoland respectively).

thejas yes, I think the patch apply as-is on branch 1.0. It comes from HIVE-9853.
Poke me, if it must be regenerated.
Any news on this one? thejas, vikram.dixit, brocknoland
This issue has been fixed and released as part of the 1.2.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.
